result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING ( 13 pages) commencing 06-21-2022 by KAITLYN EDWARDS.
for Bail Modification (pro se), received and filed

Defendant Timothy J McGee in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Timothy J McGee in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Glendale Officer R. Poetzl. Court took judicial notice of 21CF1750 & 21CF2004 and prior conviction in 17CF498 (Washington County). State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Judge Franke.   
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Timothy J McGee not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Sargent to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Timothy J McGee in court by telephone with Attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski who appears by video.  Defendant Timothy J McGee in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
